briefdescription.para: Construct a QgsTriangle from three QgsPointV2.
Construct a QgsTriangle from three QgsPoint.
Construct a QgsTriangle from three QPointF.
Inherited method not used. You cannot add an interior ring into a triangle.
An altitude is a segment (defined by a QgsLineString) from a vertex to the opposite side (or, if necessary, to the extension of the opposite side).

simplesect.para:
Three altitudes from this triangle. An empty list is returned for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) [alt.asWkt()foraltintri.altitudes()] #['LineString(00,05)','LineString(05,2.52.5)','LineString(55,05)'] QgsTriangle().altitudes() #[]

briefdescription.para: Returns the three angles of the triangle.

simplesect.para:
Angles in radians of triangle ABC where angle BAC is at 0, angle ABC is at 1, angle BCA is at 2. An empty list is returned for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) [math.degrees(i)foriintri.angles()] #[45.0,90.0,45.0] QgsTriangle().angles() #[]

memberdef.argsstring: (QDomDocument &doc, int precision=17, const QString &ns="gml", QgsAbstractGeometry::AxisOrder axisOrder=QgsAbstractGeometry::AxisOrder::XY) const override
memberdef.name: asGml3

briefdescription.para: Returns a GML3 representation of the geometry.

parameterdescription.para: number of decimal places for coordinates

briefdescription.para: The segment (defined by a QgsLineString) returned bisect the angle of a vertex to the opposite side.

simplesect.para:
Three angle bisector from this triangle. An empty list is returned for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) [bis.asWkt()forbisintri.bisectors()] #['LineString(00,2.071067811865474625)','LineString(05,2.52.5)','LineString(55,02.92893218813452538)'] QgsTriangle().bisectors() #[]

briefdescription.para: Returns the closure of the combinatorial boundary of the geometry (ie the topological boundary of the geometry).

detaileddescription.para:
For instance, a polygon geometry will have a boundary consisting of the linestrings for each ring in the polygon.
boundary for geometry. May be null for some geometry types.
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Cast the geom to a QgsTriangle.

detaileddescription.para: Should be used by qgsgeometry_cast<QgsTriangle *>( geometry ).

simplesect.para: Not available in Python. Objects will be automatically be converted to the appropriate target type.
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Center of the circumscribed circle of the triangle.

simplesect.para:
The center of the circumscribed circle of the triangle. An empty point is returned for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.circumscribedCenter().asWkt() #'Point(2.52.5)' QgsTriangle().circumscribedCenter().asWkt() #'Point(00)'

briefdescription.para: Circumscribed circle of the triangle.

simplesect.para: The circumbscribed of the triangle with a QgsCircle. An empty circle is returned for empty triangle. Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.circumscribedCircle() #QgsCircle(Point(2.52.5),3.5355339059327378,0) QgsTriangle().circumscribedCircle() #QgsCircle()

briefdescription.para: Radius of the circumscribed circle of the triangle.

simplesect.para:
The radius of the circumscribed circle of the triangle. 0.0 is returned for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.circumscribedRadius() #3.5355339059327378 QgsTriangle().circumscribedRadius() #0.0

briefdescription.para: Clears the geometry, ie reset it to a null geometry.
Clones the geometry by performing a deep copy.
Creates a new geometry with the same class and same WKB type as the original and transfers ownership.

detaileddescription.para:
To create it, the geometry is default constructed and then the WKB is changed.
clone()
3.0

briefdescription.para: Inherited method not used. You cannot delete or insert a vertex directly. Returns always false.
Sets the geometry from a WKB string.

detaileddescription.para:
After successful read the wkb argument will be at the position where the reading has stopped.
fromWkt

briefdescription.para: Sets the geometry from a WKT string.
Returns a unique string representing the geometry type.
Center of the inscribed circle of the triangle.

detaileddescription.para:
Z dimension is supported and is retrieved from the first 3D point amongst vertices.
The center of the inscribed circle of the triangle. An empty point is returned for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.inscribedCenter().asWkt() #'Point(1.464466094067262253.53553390593273775)' QgsTriangle().inscribedCenter().asWkt() #'Point(00)'

briefdescription.para: Inscribed circle of the triangle.

simplesect.para: The inscribed of the triangle with a QgsCircle. An empty circle is returned for empty triangle. Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.inscribedCircle() #QgsCircle(Point(1.464466094067262253.53553390593273775),1.4644660940672622,0) QgsTriangle().inscribedCircle() #QgsCircle()

briefdescription.para: Radius of the inscribed circle of the triangle.

simplesect.para:
The radius of the inscribed circle of the triangle. 0.0 is returned for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.inscribedRadius() #1.4644660940672622 QgsTriangle().inscribedRadius() #0.0

briefdescription.para: Inherited method not used. You cannot delete or insert a vertex directly. Returns always false.
Convenient method checking if the geometry is degenerate (have duplicate or colinear point(s)).

simplesect.para: True if the triangle is degenerate or empty, otherwise false. Example: tri=QgsTriangle() tri.isDegenerate() #True tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.isDegenerate() #False tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(5,5),QgsPoint(10,10)) tri.isDegenerate() #True tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.isDegenerate() #True

briefdescription.para: Is the triangle equilateral (three sides with the same length)?

simplesect.para:
True or False. Always false for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(10,10),QgsPoint(16,10),QgsPoint(13,15.1962)) tri.lengths() #[6.0,6.0000412031918575,6.0000412031918575] tri.isEquilateral() #True #Alllengthsarecloseto6.0 QgsTriangle().isEquilateral() #False

briefdescription.para: Is the triangle isocele (two sides with the same length)?

simplesect.para:
True or False. Always false for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.lengths() #[5.0,5.0,7.0710678118654755] tri.isIsocele() #True #lengthof[AB]==lengthof[BC] QgsTriangle().isIsocele() #False

briefdescription.para: Is the triangle right-angled?

simplesect.para:
True or False. Always false for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) [math.degrees(i)foriintri.angles()] #[45.0,90.0,45.0] tri.isRight() #True #angleofABC==90 QgsTriangle().isRight() #False

briefdescription.para: Is the triangle scalene (all sides have different lengths)?

simplesect.para:
True or False. Always false for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(7.2825,4.2368),QgsPoint(13.0058,3.3218),QgsPoint(9.2145,6.5242)) tri.lengths() #[5.795980321740233,4.962793714229921,2.994131386562721] tri.isScalene() #True #Alllengthsaredifferent QgsTriangle().isScalene() #False

briefdescription.para: Returns the three lengths of the triangle.

simplesect.para:
Lengths of triangle ABC where [AB] is at 0, [BC] is at 1, [CA] is at 2. An empty list is returned for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.lengths() #[5.0,5.0,7.0710678118654755] QgsTriangle().lengths() #[]

briefdescription.para: Medial (or midpoint) triangle of a triangle ABC is the triangle with vertices at the midpoints of the triangle's sides.

simplesect.para:
The medial from this triangle. An empty triangle is returned for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.medial().asWkt() #'Triangle((02.5,2.55,2.52.5,02.5))' QgsTriangle().medial().asWkt() #'Triangle()'

briefdescription.para: A median is a segment (defined by a QgsLineString) from a vertex to the midpoint of the opposite side.

simplesect.para:
Three medians from this triangle. An empty list is returned for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) [med.asWkt()formedintri.medians()] #['LineString(00,2.55)','LineString(05,2.52.5)','LineString(55,02.5)'] QgsTriangle().medians() #[]

briefdescription.para: Moves a vertex within the geometry.

parameterdescription.para: vertex id for vertex to move

simplesect.para: true if move was successful

briefdescription.para: An orthocenter is the point of intersection of the altitudes of a triangle.

simplesect.para:
The orthocenter of the triangle. An empty point is returned for empty triangle.
Example: tri=QgsTriangle(QgsPoint(0,0),QgsPoint(0,5),QgsPoint(5,5)) tri.orthocenter().asWkt() #'Point(05)' QgsTriangle().orthocenter().asWkt() #'Point(00)'

briefdescription.para: Sets the exterior ring of the polygon.

detaileddescription.para:
The CurvePolygon type will be updated to match the dimensionality of the exterior ring. For instance, setting a 2D exterior ring on a 3D CurvePolygon will drop the z dimension from the CurvePolygon and all interior rings.
ring
new exterior ring. Ownership is transferred to the CurvePolygon.
setInteriorRings()
exteriorRing()

briefdescription.para: Inherited method not used.

detaileddescription.para:
You cannot add an interior ring into a triangle.
not available in Python bindings

briefdescription.para: Gets a polygon representation of this surface.

detaileddescription.para: Ownership is transferred to the caller.

briefdescription.para: Returns the geometry converted to the more generic curve type QgsCurvePolygon.

simplesect.para: the converted geometry. Caller takes ownership

briefdescription.para: Returns coordinates of a vertex.

simplesect.para: Coordinates of the vertex or QgsPoint(0,0) on error (atVertex < 0 or > 3).

briefdescription.para: Triangle geometry type.

simplesect.para: QGIS 3.0
